reviewText:
This review is for the "FUNOC Fashion New Women Vintage Wool Round Cloche Cap" in red.

The hat arrived in a 4-inch-high shipping box, that meant it had to be flattened  to fit into the box.  It probably would have sprung back into a decent enough shape to wear, but I don't know --- because it's too small for my (evidently giant) head.  Granted, a cloche style is meant to be worn snug on the head, but the crown needs to be deep to fit properly and this was not.  When I managed to force it down onto my head it just popped back up because it's too shallow (I am only 5'2" tall btw.)

The fit is nothing like how it looks on the model in the item photo.  The size of the hat I received is more appropriate for a 10-year-old than a grown woman.

Other than the size issue, the color was true to what was shown in the photo.  The quality isn't great (it's lightweight and doesn't have a ton of structure) but considering how inexpensive the hat is I would have been happy -- if only it had fit.
summary: Too Small Hat or My Giant Head?

OK, first off this is not a review of the vendor, but of the product manufacturer.  I purchased this winder approx 5 1/2 months ago.  At first everything was fine, but about 9 days ago one of the motors stopped functioning.  I contacted the seller, who refereed me to the manufacturer Belocia.  I contacted Belocia by email, and they replied with either send it in for repair or they would send me a new motor.  I replied that I would take the motor and perform the repair myself.....that was the last I've heard from them.  Over the course of 8 days, they have ignored my daily email inquiries as to the status of the situation.  The phone number provided on their site always goes to voicemail.......so I guess I'm out $130 for a 3 space winder that can only wind one watch.  Purchaser beware, if you get a good one you're fine.  If you need post sales support you are out of luck......

reviewText: It's honestly worth the money for the vest, and it saved me $70. I ordered a size up and fits fine, but what I'm angry about is that I only received the vest. The color is blueish - grey,  and I cannot  find a tie to match which shouldn't even be a problem since I was supposed to have a tie that came with it.

I'm 6'2" and 335lbs, every time time I see my doctor he calls me obese and tells me that I need to weigh 150lbs. I see his point of view as he is going off what I look like on "paper". Physically speaking I am not a disabled obese person, I'm always into sports especially extreme sports like mountain biking and skateboarding. Yes I am the big guy that can keep up with the skinny guys.
Now as for this vest; right off the back I'll tell you it comes as a slim so it's about one or two sizes to small. I wear a 3xl-tall, usually if I buy a normal 3xl tshirt like at wally world it will fit but it's just a tad bit to short. Hence why I buy tall. But anyways I figured it wouldn't be to bad as I just needed it for my sisters wedding and figured that I would only wear it once. I received in the mail, came with everything it said it would. The material feels about wally world material so not to bad if you're a cheap-o like myself. But as soon as I tried it on I could tell it wasn't going to fit, it was tight around my armpits, needed about 3 inches to close and it was wwaayyy to short. It came up mid way on my back just standing straight. All in all to save you some time and you want something cheap for a one time use get this vest but get a size or two bigger then normal, depending on how baggie you wear your clothes.
I gave this vest to my dad, he usually wears L or XL and this 3XL fit him perfect.
summary: get a size or two bigger then normal, good product

reviewText:
The vest said "S" but fit like at least a large.  Because he needed it for Prom in a few days, we had a tailor take it in 2 inches on each side!
The maroon color was as pictured, vest was nicely lined.  But it was not a small

Ordered a Small for my son, but the fit is more like a large/extra large.  The sewn in tag is definitely an "S". The vest when buttoned and measured flat is about 21" at the pockets, so it is about 42" of material around the waist area. That's way too much material for a small.  My son has a 34 chest and 29 waist. The sizing chart for the Small listed chest =34-36, waist 28-30, so the small should have worked for him.  I read the reviews that the vest ran small for many people, but that was the opposite of our experience.  The small ran very large.  So, perhaps the wrong sizes were put on these vests.  The Small Enimay vest is even a bit big on my husband who usually wears a Large.  The good: quality fabric, workmanship, and color (maroon), tie and pocket hankie included.  The bad:  sizing.  Perhaps I should order an extra large to get a small?!  Ha!
summary: Small is closer to a large, extra large

I was conflicted about the number of stars to give this.  I give the concept and design 5 stars.  I am a die-hard Seahawks fan and I love to be able to show my spirit.  The Bradford Exchange allowed me to return the Seahawks bracelet and exchange it for the Seahawks Superbowl bracelet because I ordered it before the Superbowl - then they won and I definitely wanted the Lombardi trophy charm; however, it took at least four phone calls and I can't tell you how many emails to accomplish this. The charms are nice.  The football helmet is quite detailed.  The charms include the helmet, football, jersey, green and blue beads, hearts with the Seahawks name and crystal, Seahawks name charm and the Lombardy trophy.  I would give 1 star to the customer service department - intentions are good but the follow through is terrible.  The biggest disappointment is the quality of the materials used to make the bracelet - it turns my arm green and dark blue.  $120 for a bracelet that turns my arm green/dark blue? For the price of this bracelet, they should have used sterling silver or another metal that isn't so cheap instead of the cheapest silver plating around.  I guess I should be happy that at least when my skin turns color from the bracelet - it turns into Seahawks colors!
summary: Great design idea; cheap execution - at least it turns my skin Seahawks Blue and Green!

When I ordered this watch I wasn't expecting very much at all, I was pleasantly surprised. First let me say this is a big watch 52 mm diameter, its supposed to be stainless steel but it's way too light for that. The back may be stainless but the rest is a mystery metal possibly aluminum polished or plated. The detail is good with no obvious dust under the glass (it is at least glass and not some acrylic material) The dial is not printed but has actual hands and numerals that look like they have been attached as separate parts. Around the bezel are 4 machine screw heads which are also real, unlike some watches of this style that have printed or screened screw heads on the surface of the glass. The strap is supposed to be real leather? Its possible but the surface feels like no leather I have ever seen or felt before. All in all for $30+ it's not a bad watch at all. The strap will only fit up to an 7 3/4" wrist, the 3 small sub-dials are non-working and I don't think it will stand up to a lot of abuse. But at this price I would buy it again or one of the other offerings from this company.

Misleading item description, since they are not Thermal Long Johns, instead should be listed as Nylon-Lycra Men's Leggings. Beware of why you are purchasing these. If you are looking for a warm pair of Long Johns as I was, this is not your product. If you are looking for a pair of leggings with ample package space, then order away!
sexy

When these first came, I was a little disappointed that they really are not warm. Thermal is not a word to describe them. They are thin. They are very stretchy material and they do fit very well. I would think they would fit a wide range of packages owing to the fact that they do stretch and form fit. I tried them because I wanted low-rise long johns that don't reach halfway up your stomach while the crotch sags halfway to your knees. These don't do either of those things. But I did want them to be warm, which again, they are not particularly. The cargo container in front gives room so they don't crush you, but they don't sag either. The stretchy material leaves all the room anyone might need to accommodate the typical expansions and contractions that naturally occur. They are styled, cut and stitched so that they hug your buns and fill in the gap and hold to your shape, so they work well and look good under jeans. It took a bit of getting used to the feel of them at first, but not long, as they feel quite nice against the skin and they look good too. To be honest, they almost feel like they gently massage your legs and bum. Im not sure Id like to be taken to jail or the hospital in them though.

Pros:
+Fit great.
+Feel great.
+Inexpensive.
+Dont, won't & cant sag.
+Dont bind, constrict or crush.
+Work well and look good under jeans.

Cons:
-Not thermal underwear for warmth
summary: Wasn't so sure at first, but I'll buy them again.

reviewText:
This is the first ratcheting belt that I've had and am quite pleased with it. I've been wearing it for about 3-4 weeks, and thus far have seen no problems mechanically nor any indication of abnormal wear. I really am pleased with the greater adjustability of it compared to a traditional belt and buckle.

The belt is a little wider than other "dress" belts that I've had. It measures just under 1-3/8" wide. The leather quality appears to be satisfactory, the ratchet track stitching appears to be fine as well.

The buckle is good, thick, and heavy. It measures about 2-1/2" wide by 1-3/8" tall. The quality appears to be excellent, there are no rough spots on it and the ratcheting and release mechanism work smoothly.

I bought a brown belt, wishing that it were a little darker than pictured. The good news for me is that it is indeed a good bit darker, I'd call it dark brown.

As this is my first ratcheting belt, I was very conservative in cutting the belt to length while trying to keep the excess to an acceptable length. I may yet cut off another inch or so to get it right. It does appear that you might need to leave a little more length than some other belt types to ensure that the buckle mechanism can engage the ratchet strap. I'd highly recommend buying a longer length than you might normally wear to ensure you have plenty.
The black ribbon neckband can be a little tricky to manipulate, and the green was much more artificial in person.  That being said, I didn't pay much, and they were totally worth it :)

Just got these today, and they are super comfy! They were a little longer than I was expecting but it's fine, they are still short enough for my needs (Which is wearing them under short dresses). The material is soft and comfortable. I probably could have gone down to a Large instead of an XL but the XL still fits just fine and I would say these run pretty true to size as my usual size is around a 12. Definitely can see myself using these for yoga and other exercises too, but they are great to pair with an outfit where you want a little more coverage on your upper legs! As other reviews have said, they do ride up a little on the thighs but again, not really a deal breaker. I don't anticipate it showing from under clothing. The hem's lip around the waist also lies pretty flat, which was something I was concerned about given some workout shorts have an obnoxiously thick waistband which would make them obvious under clothing worn over them. But thankfully! The waistline and hems all lie pretty smooth. Definitely recommend these comfy shorts!

They have the right amount of stretch and don't ride up in the back when bending over, so I won't have to be in the back row of Yoga class. :-)  The little pocket in the front waistband is a nice touch - not sure I'll ever use it, but it's a nice size and would hold a house/car key (but probably not a ring of keys), and maybe a few dollars folded up and/or a credit card or ID.  I got these shorts in both pink and blue, and the colors are just slightly more intense than the picture shows (or it could be that my monitor makes them appear a little washed out in the photos), but they're still pretty true to the photos in terms of color.  I will probably order a few more in different colors.

NOTE ABOUT OTHER REVIEWERS comments about the sizing and 'cameltoe' issue - ladies be realistic about your size. I think all sizes are beautiful and I have some very curvy/voluptuous friends that I envy, so this is not a body-size criticism, just a comment about figuring out what size you should order.  If you are under 5'6" and weigh over 125 lbs, a small will cause cameltoe problems. Order a medium instead. The material is stretchy, but even stretchy materials have limits. Several reviewers who complained about the small being too small (and listed their height and weight) my first thought was "well I'm not surprised, they should have ordered a medium, not a small.  I weigh 112lbs.... if I weighed 140lbs, they would be too tight on me too.

I would've loved to wear it with flats but I will need to wear 4 inch heels with this dress. It can also be manipulated in a way that conceals your waistline or accentuates it. I'm quite busty (34-D) yet the top doesn't give me a plunging neckline.

This was the 1st PattyBoutik item I bought and wow! I was super impressed! Since then, I've purchased dozens of items from this brand and they've become a major staple in my closet. This investment has made outfit planning so much easier and I am now able to get ready and dressed much more quickly.

Consistently, these garments are made from high quality, soft material. I appreciate how they aren't see through (although I've heard that some of the shirts are but I've never experienced this with any of the ones I own).

Additionally, I love the way they're cut: They seem to be designed for women with curves. Most clothes look funny on me as my bust and rear are larger and my waist is small. Subsequently, many shirts, sweaters and dresses either don't fit my chest or make my waist look big. This brand hugs all the right spots... And without looking trashy or over revealing.

Also, the rouched accents on many of the tops and dresses are very forgiving, which makes them ideal during the post-pregnancy months. With that said, these details do NOT add extra weight or bulk. I think the designer of these garments must be a brilliant individual who understands women's bodies well.

Let me clarify: Yes, this brand is made in China. And I'm pretty sure it's actually a Chinese company as well. But please be rest assured that there are NOT cheap "MADE IN CHINA" clothing. Patty garments are a great value and come with a certain level of quality that I have come to appreciate greatly.

I've been telling all my friends about Patty!!!

However, after wearing it a few times, the ring turned my finger a muddled, unsightly brown color, which is quite odd - I am not certain whether this was the finish wearing off, or whether this was because of a chemical reaction with my skin (yet, I am positively sure that if it were the latter it would have turned that all too common green color).  Overall, I rated this item five stars though because of the prompt service, shipment, and reception of the bracelet/ring - it was certainly in good condition, and was listed with a great cost and free shipping - hence five out of five stars. [*****/*****]

reviewText:
I got these for my wife as she wanted big hoop earrings. I got these along with a few other sets of bigger sized hoops.

I was leary over the price on these because my wife (well her body chemistry rather) is very finicky in regards to what she can wear. She pretty much turns anything that isn't pure silver or 24k gold into a green mess of gunk.

I was hopeful that these would pass the test because the were near pure silver.

They lasted fine for a while (about 2 weeks of daily wear) and then started making her ears itch and finally ended in the green gunk.

The earrings looked beautiful and for most people would be awesome. But with my wife's chemistry they just didn't work.

Now I'd normally say 3 stars but this company reminds me of Amazon. They are a great customer oriented company! Totally willing to work with you and desirous of making you happy. I'd gladly buy from these guys again as they were more than willing to make everything right.
summary: She pretty much turns anything that isn't pure silver or 24k ...
